alert.note: Alert for Fayette (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 8:22PM EDT until May 07 at 7:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Ross, Fayette, and Clinton counties in Ohio. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 821 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported minor flooding in various locations across the advisory area, with several roads still closed. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Washington Court House, Wilmington, Blanchester, Sabina, New Holland, Staunton, Good Hope, Frankfort, Clarksville, Harveysburg, Martinsville, Clarksburg, Midland, Port William, Milledgeville, Octa, Lees Creek, Reesville, Jasper Mills and Melvin.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
